column4: could anyone help me with a partitioning problem i have? partman crashes on me when i try to install linux
says exit code 10 if that rings a bell... cant find anything on google and ive tried a good few things by now but im running out of ideas
just use a whitespace id say
or wildcard sry
rm *-1.jpg ?
rm */*/*-1.jpg? i dunno if that would push it i have no idea
lol ok as the n00b ill shut up now :P
does ubuntu have something like chkdsk?
Yes, fsck
Can you pastebin the output of "sudo blkid"?
http://pastebin.com/H2n5LnKU
It's interesting that blkid only finds one raid member.
disk utility sees the two as far as i know
One of the devices is /dev/sda, what is the other?
2 secs
http://azcld.dyndns.info/disk-util.png
get it?
It's odd, because at the same time this disk utility is claiming that sdb is somehow part of an array, and yet /dev/sdb1 is a mountable partition in and of itself.
yup... anything i can further do to diagnose it?

Try "sudo parted -l". You could also try mounting /dev/sdb1 and see if it gets you what you want. Since there is obviously something I'm not understanding about this though I can't guarantee that attempting to mount /dev/sdb1 will be safe.
Error: /dev/sda: unrecognised disk label
That makes sense since /dev/sda is a member of a raid0 array. It's possible that /dev/sdb is the "first" member of the array, and so has the blocks containing the partition table.
But that doesn't explain how /dev/sdb1 can appear to contain a valid ntfs filesystem as well.
